instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not power on short
threads.message:
Sitting with a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> logic board with liquid damage around <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> area and j6995.

it have short on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> (i lift the L6995 and injectt 3,2V) but can't find something that been heatet up (i only get 0.23A on the PSU)
have also replace the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not power on short
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not power on short
threads.message: this was probably nothing but the cap under the foam by the BIL and you trashed it ? :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not power on short
threads.message: I have remove smc, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>,<CHIP>U6901</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>,<CHIP>U7941</CHIP> a lot off capacitors and resistor i get 2.6 Ohm on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not power on short
threads.message: [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] .... Think i found it L6440 removed an now have 0.377 in diode mode..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not power on short
threads.message: Will try to putt all the missing components back again an see :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not power on short
threads.message:
Wasn't L6400?
The board should work without it; no mic, of course...
To solve that, check <CAPACITOR>C6403</CAPACITOR>/05 and <CHIP>U6400</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not power on short
threads.message: sorry my fault mean L6400.. have remove <CHIP>U6400</CHIP> also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not power on short
threads.message: It's the cap under the foam. You won't see/feel it getting hot if you ignore the foam. Get it!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not power on short
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C6403</CAPACITOR> is the cap mentioned by Louis, so remove it...
